  <p>Hi, I'm Elgin. I am a 4th year PhD candidate in the <a href="https://pekoszlab.com">Pekosz Lab</a> at the <a href="https://publichealth.jhu.edu/">Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health</a> in <a href="https://publichealth.jhu.edu/departments/molecular-microbiology-and-immunology">Molecular Microbiology and Immunology</a>. I study the evolutionary interface between Influenza B Viruses and the host reponse at nasal epithelial barrier.  Additionally, I maintain <a href="https://nextstrain.org/groups/PekoszLab-Public">27 Nextstrain builds</a> for seasonal genomic surveillance of H1N1, H3N2 and B/Victoria viruses from patients in the Johns Hopkins Hospital Network. </p>
